before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9r1","text":"Prior to each process, pre-warm culture media to room-temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8kh2","text":"Where required, prepare an aliquot of 1mg/ml puromycin (working concentration) by diluting a 10mg/ml stock 1:10 with sterile water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"992gr","text":"On Day 4 of the puromycin titration process, bring Cell Titer-Glo 2.0 reagent to room temperature. (It is light-sensitive and so it is advisable to keep the reagent covered at all times to avoid exposure to light when using).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36b2b","text":"Prior to gRNA library transduction, thaw an aliquot of (10mg/ml) polybrene ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6osqn","text":"Where required, thaw the required volume of lentivirus for each process stage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mt98","text":"When fixing organoids, dilute 37% formaldehyde solution 1:10 with DPBS and store at   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"30eb7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fuada","text":"This protocol is for whole-genome CRISPR screening of stably expressing Cas9 cancer organoid lines in triplicate using the commercially available minimal genome-wide human CRISPR Cas9 library. The protocol uses lentiviral transduction as a method for gRNA delivery. This method can be adapted for other gRNA libraries. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o9pg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmoiu","text":"The protocol can be followed assuming the following is known:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eje0","text":"- The number of days required for screening","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eegc3","text":"- The size of the gRNA library","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fooio","text":"- The required coverage of the library","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18m0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jfn4","text":"To allow for efficient scale up of the organoid culture for screen, a 5% suspension culture method can be used. This is not essential to be able to perform whole-genome CRISPR screening of stably expressing Cas9 cancer organoid lines, but provides a more scalable, ergonomic and cost efficient culturing method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff88u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqivd","text":"Prior to commencing the screen a puromycin antibiotic titration is used to identify the most suitable puromycin concentration for the selection of Cas9 positive cancer organoid lines transduced with gRNA library virus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah2ef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9td9d","text":"A gRNA library titration is then performed to determine the volume of library virus required to transduce Cas9 cancer cells at 30% transduction efficiency which is calculated using FACS analysis. This is to avoid host cells taking up more than one gRNA copy per cell, therefore an MOI of 30% should be aimed for.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsu7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0976","text":"Process ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0vmh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f17l6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ui8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er131","text":"This protocol uses a 21-23 day screen process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sii5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":223,"id":459528,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5nv49\",\"text\":\"Process diagram outlining key steps for CRISPR-Cas9 screening in guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"18e3d","text":"It is important that all stages are carried out using the stably expressing Cas9 version of each cancer organoid line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":118}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f4hb","text":"
Ensure the cell suspension is mixed thoroughly at all stages to create an even single cell suspension before plating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ot67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0ljq","text":"Avoid maintenance of organoids in a single-cell state for prolonged periods to retain viability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r7t9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9q8l","text":"Avoid freeze/thaw cycles of lentivirus stocks. Prioritising freshly prepared virus stocks will ensure viral integrity is maintained. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ko7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmkl0","text":"Puromycin titration;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qrdh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aq5h","text":"It is advised to use black 96-well plates in this protocol, as luminescence can carry over into surrounding wells in clear plates.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsf0e","text":"All steps involved in the plate set up, including seeding cells, media, antibiotics and CellTiter-Glo should be carried out using reservoirs and multi-channel pipettes where possible to reduce ergonomic strain and to maintain homogeneous solutions throughout. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccbvk","text":"
gRNA library titration;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1f9j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajhjm","text":"The volumes of library titrated may differ depending on the batch of lentivirus or library used. To achieve a 30% MOI there may therefore be a requirement to dilute the virus prior to titrating. For this reason, an increased number of titration points may also be required. This may require some R&D to determine optimal volumes to titrate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e365m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r3pi","text":"gRNA library transduction and screen;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ddvg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8kgv","text":"The gRNA library transduction is carried out in triplicate with 12.5 x10^6 cells seeded per replicate. Expansion of the line to a minimum of 40 x10^6 cells is required for this process. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1phki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao14c","text":"Following selection at Day 6 the organoid suspension should remain in puromycin selection media for the remainder of the screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eftps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs2pn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvo96","text":"Unless otherwise stated, all steps should be performed under sterile conditions in a microbiological safety cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":116}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64alv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
